Posts.Content: MauiKay wrote: I read an article on the M.D.Anderson site about using an anesthesia during surgey that prevents a lot of the pain signals triggered during surgery.  It is alled "Paravertebral block" supported by Dr. Farzin Goravanchi, D.O.  It is supposed to have no side effects and people feel able to leave the hospital 1 1/2hrs. after surgery. Has anyone experienced this anesthesia or have recommendations to avoid the post surgery anesthesia problems? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Ansthesia choics MauiKay iodine

Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2008 08:34PM MauiKay wrote: I'll be traveling from Maui to M.D.Anderson for double mastectomy and reconstruction.  These topics are helpful on what to take.  With an 11 hour plane ride, the pillow between me and the seat belt is an excellent idea.  I may be in hospital 4-5 days.  What is best to wear?  Everybody says no valuables but I'm hoping an iPod will help...guess I'll have to take the risk.  I won't have anyone with me until I leave the hospital so I need to plan to be independent.
Posts.Title: Is there a "packing list" for surgery? Panchoandlefty lvtwoqlt
